dataset.name: Palliative and end of life care

concept.name: Person demographics
concept.implamentationGuidance:
The mandatory information in this section is person’s name, date of birth and address. There can be multiple addresses associated with a person including temporary and correspondence addresses. These are stored on the PDS.  <br clear="none"/> 
                                 <br clear="none"/> Note that the Individual requirements section includes specific elements for accessible information requirements to support communication. It is recognised that some of the elements in this section are currently shared in a more granular way than currently defined in this information model. PRSB intends to address this in a later release of the
                                information model.
concept.description: The person's details and contact information.

concept.name: Person name
concept.description: Details of the person's name

concept.name: Person first name
concept.description: The first name(s) of the person. This includes middle names.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person given name

concept.name: Person family name
concept.description: The family name or surname of the person
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Person family name

concept.name: Person preferred name
concept.description: The name by which a person wishes to be addressed. The preferred name volunteered by the person or a preferred name given by PDS that the person has asked to be called by.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Person full name

concept.name: Title
concept.description: Person's title
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Person Title

concept.name: Person name suffix
concept.description: A textual suffix that may be added to the end of a PERSON's name, for example, OBE, MBE, BSc, JP, GM
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Person suffix

concept.name: Person full name
concept.description: The full name of the person in text representation.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person full name

concept.name: Date of birth
concept.description: The date of birth of the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- Person birth date

concept.name: Gender
concept.description: The person's stated gender.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person stated gender code

concept.name: Ethnicity
concept.description: The ethnicity of the person as specified by the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Ethnic category

concept.name: Religion
concept.description: The religious affiliation as specified by the person.

concept.name: Sex
concept.description: The person’s phenotypic sex. Determines how the person will be treated clinically.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - person phenotypic sex

concept.name: NHS number
concept.description: The unique identifier for a person within the NHS in England and Wales.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- NHS number

concept.name: NHS number status indicator
concept.description: Provides an indication of the reliability of an NHS Number.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- NHS Number Code Status Indicator

concept.name: Other identifier
concept.description: Country specific or local identifier, e.g. Community Health Index (CHI) in Scotland.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Local patient identifier(extended), Health and care number (NI only), Community health index number (Scotland only)

concept.name: Person's address
concept.description: Person’s usual place of residence, and where relevant temporary and correspondence addresses.

concept.name: Address line 1
concept.description: Person's first line of address.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :-  Address line 1

concept.name: Address line 2
concept.description: Person's second line of address.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Address line 2

concept.name: Address line 3
concept.description: Person's third line of address.

concept.name: Address line 4
concept.description: Person's fourth line of address.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Address line 4

concept.name: Address line 5
concept.description: Person's fifth line of address.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Address line 5

concept.name: Postcode
concept.description: The person's postcode.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Postcode of usual address

concept.name: Address type
concept.description: The type of address e.g. Main address, Temp address
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Address Association Type

concept.name: Person's contact details
concept.description: Details of the person's contact information.

concept.name: Preferred contact method
concept.description: Preferred contact method, e.g. email, letter, phone, text message etc.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- Preferred Contact Method

concept.name: Person's telephone number details
concept.description: The person's telephone number details

concept.name: Person's telephone number
concept.description: The person's telephone number
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - UK telephone number

concept.name: Person's telephone number type
concept.description: The contact type e.g. home, mobile
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set: - Contact point use

concept.name: Preference of telephone number
concept.description: The preferred order of use for the telephone number
concept.valueSets: Preference of use 1-5, 1 being the highest.

concept.name: Person's email address details
concept.description: Details of the person's email address

concept.name: Person's email address
concept.description: Email address of the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- Contact Email Address

concept.name: Person's email address type
concept.description: The type of email address, home, work.
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set: - Contact point use

concept.name: Preference of email address
concept.description: The preferred order of use of email address
concept.valueSets: Preference of use 1-5, 1 being the highest.

concept.name: Other contact information
concept.description: Contact details via fax, sms, url.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- Communication contact string

concept.name: Marital status
concept.description: An indicator to identify the legal marital status of the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person marital status

concept.name: Organ and tissue donation
concept.description: Whether the person has opted out of automatic organ and/or tissue donation where applicable. This is information provided by the national register.

concept.name: GP practice
concept.description: Details of the person's GP practice.

concept.name: GP practice record entry
concept.description: This is an GP practice record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items

concept.name: GP name
concept.description: The name of the person's GP. If the person is registered with a GP practice, their usual GP name will be something volunteered by the person or their representative.

concept.name: GP practice details
concept.description: Name and address of the person's registered GP Practice. Registered GP practice details are available from the Person Dempographics Service (PDS), or volunteered from the person or their representative. Include details of the practice name and address.

concept.name: GP practice identifier
concept.description: The identifier of the registered GP practice.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - General medical practice code (patient registration)

concept.name: About me
concept.description: About me

concept.name: What is most important to me
concept.description: A description of what is most important to you.

concept.name: What is most important to me
concept.description:
A description of what is most important to you.
 
Emergency Information : - Include any essential information that any professional in health and social care should know about the you in any situation, including emergencies.
 
Other Information : -This could include : - Values, Spirituality/religion, Ethnicity, Culture, Pets, Goals and aspirations, Meaningful activities including leisure activities, visiting places, sport and exercise, listening to music, employment, education, volunteering.

concept.name: People who are important to me
concept.description: Details of who is important to you and why.

concept.name: People who are important to me
concept.description:
Details of who is important to you and why. They could be family members, carers, friends, members of staff etc. Include how you want the people important to you to be engaged and involved in your care and support in both emergency and normal situations. Include how you stay connected to the people important to you. Who should not be contacted or
                            consulted about your care and support and why, if you wish to say

concept.name: How I communicate and how to communicate with me
concept.description: A description of how you communicate normally.

concept.name: How I communicate and how to communicate with me
concept.description:
A description of how you communicate normally including any communication aids you use, for example a hearing aid.

  • Include your preferred language of communication, if your first language is not English.
  • Include how you would communicate when you are in pain or distress.
  • Include how you communicate choices.
  • Include how you give feedback or raise a concern.
  • Include how you like to receive information

Describe how you would like others to engage and communicate with you, including how you would like to be addressed.

concept.name: My wellness
concept.description: A description covering what you are able to do, how you engage with others and how you feel on a typical day through to on a day when you are unwell or really unwell.

concept.name: My wellness
concept.description:
A description covering what you are able to do, how you engage with others and how you feel on a typical day through to on a day when you are unwell or really unwell

  • Include any causes that might result in you becoming unwell and strategies for avoiding or addressing the causes. For example, not drinking enough water could cause constipation.
  • Include any signs that indicate you might be becoming unwell.
  • On a bad day describe what is different about what you are able to do, how you engage with others and how you feel.
  • Include how your everyday life is affected by any medical conditions e.g. dementia and any symptoms e.g. itchiness, cough, pain and how you manage those conditions.
  • Include past health issues or experiences that need to be considered
  • Include your wellbeing and lifestyle goals and aspirations

concept.name: Please do and please don't
concept.description: A description of things you want someone supporting you to do (or not to do).

concept.name: Please do and please don't
concept.description:
A description of things you want someone supporting you to do (or not to do).
Things you want someone to  do  might include (for example): - Talk to me not to my carer, remind me to take my medication, encourage me to wash my hands regularly, explain to me what is happening and why, respond to my communication.
A description of things you  do not  want someone supporting you to do might include (for example): - Discussing or asking questions about certain topics, making assumptions about something, providing support when it is not wanted, talking to you in a certain way, undergoing a specific intervention or taking a medication the person does not want.

concept.name: How and when to support me
concept.description: A description of how and when you want someone caring for you to support you.

concept.name: How and when to support me
concept.description:
A description of how and when you want someone caring for you to support you.

  • This could include support needs in an emergency situation (for example taking blood)
  • This could include support you need to maintain important routines or to carry out particular activities, for example: - Personal care routines, Eating and drinking, Bedtime routines, Taking medications, Moving and transitioning
  • This could also include support needed with:- wearing glasses/hearing aids/false teeth etc, making informed choices or understanding dangers and risks, managing your emotions, moods and behaviours, memory or confusion.
  • Include how your support needs change in different environments. Include any triggers that might result in you needing further support and strategies for avoiding or addressing the triggers. Include how you want the support to be provided.

concept.name: Also worth knowing about me
concept.description: A description of what is also worth knowing about you for people caring or supporting you.

concept.name: Also worth knowing about me
concept.description:
A description of what is also worth knowing about you for people caring or supporting you.

  • This could include a short history of your life (where you have worked, where you lived, important events in your life, important people in your past life).
  • This could include a short profile of your current life:- your work / study, your aspirations, your skills, your networks, things you like e.g. particular foods, places, a football team and things you like to talk about, things you dislike
  • This could also include any care and support preferences that have not been included elsewhere.

concept.name: Date
concept.description: This is a record of the date that this information was last updated.

concept.name: Supported to write this by
concept.description: Where relevant, this is a record of name, relationship/role and contact details of the individual who supported the person to write this section e.g. carer, family member, advocate, professional.

concept.name: Location to multimedia file
concept.description: The link to the person's multimedia file

concept.name: Individual requirements
concept.description: The individual requirements of the person.

concept.name: Reasonable adjustment
concept.description: A record of reasonable adjustments that must be provided by the service to comply with the Equality Act 2010.

concept.name: Reasonable adjustment record entry
concept.description: This is a reasonable adjustment record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items

concept.name: Reasonable adjustment
concept.description: The reasonable adjustment required e.g. requires specific contact method, requires communication professional

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for reasonable adjustment
concept.valueSets:
SNOMED CT : - Accessible information standard
^999002121000000109 |Accessible information - communication support simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|
^999002151000000104 |Accessible information - requires communication professional simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|
^999002131000000106 |Accessible information - requires specific contact method simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|
^999002141000000102 |Accessible information - requires specific information format simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|
Refsets for other categories in development

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Reasonable adjustment additional detail
concept.description: Further detail about the support required and the consequence of not providing it.

concept.name: Impairment
concept.description: A record of any impairments for the person relating to reasonable adjustments.

concept.name: Impairment record entry
concept.description: This is an impairment record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items

concept.name: Impairment category
concept.description: The category of the impairment e.g.  Physical disability, Sensory disability - such as sight or hearing, Long-term condition.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for impairment.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Impairment additional detail
concept.description:
Description of what the person can do with the impairment, what they want to be able to do and how they should be supported to do it and what the consequences are of not providing the support.
Where there is a sensory disability include sensory processing difficulties (e.g. affects to balance and movement, oversensitive, under-sensitive).

concept.name: Cognition
concept.description: Details of the persons cognitive impairment.

concept.name: Cognition
concept.description: The cognitive impairment to be considered when communicating with the person, child or their primary carer.

concept.name: Mobility
concept.description: Details of the person's mobility needs.

concept.name: Mobility needs
concept.description: The mobility needs of the person that allows movement between two spaces and achieves participation and a degree of independence.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for mobility needs
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^999002551000000108 |Mobility findings simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Other individual requirements
concept.description: Details of any other individual requirements the person may have.

concept.name: Other individual requirement
concept.description: Other individual requirements that a person may have.

concept.name: Alerts
concept.description: Details of alerts.

concept.name: Alerts record entry
concept.description: This is an alerts record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items

concept.name: Alert
concept.description: Any significant information meriting a specific and highly visible warning to any user (e.g. metallic implant, potential dangerous pet).

concept.name: Legal information
concept.description: The legal information relating to the person.

concept.name: Consent relating to child
concept.description: Details of the person's consent relating to child

concept.name: Consent relating to child
concept.description: The person with parental responsibility or appointed guardian where a child lacks competency. Consideration of age and competency, applying Gillick competency or Fraser guidelines.

concept.name: Location of document
concept.description: The location of the consent document
concept.valueSets: Free text or URL

concept.name: Mental capacity assessment
concept.description: Details of the persons mental capacity assessment

concept.name: Mental capacity assessment
concept.description: Whether an assessment of the mental capacity of the (adult) person has been undertaken, if so, what capacity the decision relates to and the outcome of the assessment. Also record best interests decision if person lacks capacity.

concept.name: Location of document
concept.description: The location of the mental capacity assessment information.

concept.name: Lasting power of attorney for health and welfare or court-appointed deputy (or equivalent)
concept.description: Details of the person's LPA record or equivalent

concept.name: Lasting power of attorney for health and welfare or court appointed deputy (or equivalent)
concept.description:
Record of one or more people who have been given power (LPA) by the person when they had capacity to make decisions about their health and welfare should they lose capacity to make those decisions. To be valid, an LPA must have been registered with the Court of Protection. If life-sustaining treatment is being considered the LPA document must state
                            specifically that the attorney has been given power to consent to or refuse life-sustaining treatment. Details of any person (deputy) appointed by the court to make decisions about the person’s health and welfare. A deputy does not have the power to refuse life-sustaining treatment.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the LPA
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^999001951000000107 |Personal welfare lasting power of attorney findings simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Location of document
concept.description: The location of the LPA information

concept.name: Name of LPA
concept.description: The names of any appointed people or deputies

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: The contact details of the LPA
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- UK telephone number

concept.name: Lasting power of attorney for property and financial affairs or court-appointed deputy (or equivalent)
concept.description: Details of the person's LPA record or equivalent

concept.name: Lasting power of attorney for property and financial affairs or court appointed deputy (or equivalent)
concept.description:
Record of one or more people who have been given power (LPA) by the person when they had capacity to make decisions about their property and financial affairs should they lose capacity to make those decisions. To be valid, an LPA must have been registered with the Court of Protection. If life-sustaining treatment is being considered the LPA document
                            must state specifically that the attorney has been given power to consent to or refuse life-sustaining treatment. Details of any person (deputy) appointed by the court to make decisions about the person’s property and financial affairs. A deputy does not have the power to refuse life-sustaining treatment.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the LPA
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - 341041000000103 | Lasting power of attorney property and affairs (observable entity) |

concept.name: Location of document
concept.description: The location of the LPA information

concept.name: Name of LPA
concept.description: The names of any appointed people or deputies

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: The contact details of the LPA
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- UK telephone number

concept.name: Advance decision to refuse treatment (ADRT)
concept.description: Details of the person's ADRT status.

concept.name: Advance decision to refuse treatment
concept.description:
A record of an advance decision to refuse one or more specific types of future treatment, made by a person who had capacity at the time of recording the decision. The decision only applies when the person no longer has the capacity to consent to or refuse the specific treatment being considered. An ADRT must be in writing, signed and witnessed. If the
                            ADRT is refusing life-sustaining treatment it must state specifically that the treatment is refused even if the person’s life is at risk.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for advance decision to refuse treatment.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT:- ^ 999002181000000105 |Advance decision to refuse treatment preference findings simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Location of document
concept.description: Location of the advance decision to refuse treatment document
concept.valueSets: Free text or URL

concept.name: Professional contacts
concept.description: The details of the person’s professional contacts.

concept.name: Professional contacts record entry
concept.description: This is a professional contacts record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional with responsibility for the care of the person.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker, key worker, care home manager, care coordinator, LA hospital liaison person, care home contact, hospital clinician, Independent Mental Capacity Advocate (IMCA) etc
concept.valueSets: FHIR values set : -  ukcorepractitionerrolecode

concept.name: Key worker
concept.description: A flag that identifies the professional contact is the key worker assigned to the person.

concept.name: Speciality
concept.description: The specialty of the professional e.g. physiotherapy, oncology, mental health etc
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Team
concept.description: The name of the team.

concept.name: Organisation
concept.description: The name of the organisation.

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the professional (e.g. telephone number, email address etc.).

concept.name: Start date
concept.description: The start date of the professional relationship with the person.

concept.name: End date
concept.description: The end date of the professional relationship with the person.

concept.name: Personal contacts
concept.description: The details of the individual's personal contacts.

concept.name: Personal contacts record entry
concept.description: This is personal contacts record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the personal contact.

concept.name: Relationship
concept.description: The relationship the personal contact has to the person, e.g. father, grandmother, family friend etc.
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set : - Related person

concept.name: Relationship type
concept.description: Additional roles the person performs on behalf of the other (e.g. Carer, Next of Kin, Emergency Contact, Dependent, etc.)

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the personal contact (e.g. telephone number, address, email address etc.)

concept.name: Comments
concept.description: Notes on the significance of the personal contact to the person.

concept.name: Problem list
concept.description: A summary of the problems that require investigation or treatment.

concept.name: Problem list record entry
concept.description:
This is a problem list record entry.  <br clear="none"/> 
                         <br clear="none"/> There may be 0 to many record entries under problem list.  <br clear="none"/> 
                         <br clear="none"/> Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Problem
concept.description:
A condition which needs addressing and so is important for every professional to know about when seeing the person.  <br clear="none"/> 
                             <br clear="none"/> Problems may include diagnoses, symptoms, and social or behavioural issues

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the problem list.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Onset date
concept.description: A date or estimated date that the problem began

concept.name: End Date
concept.description: The date or estimated date the problem was resolved.

concept.name: Stage of disease
concept.description: The stage of the disease where relevant.

concept.name: Comment
concept.description: Supporting text may be given covering the problem.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The primary end of life problem for the person
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : -  ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

concept.name: Free text
concept.valueSets: Free text

concept.name: Description of palliative care diagnosis
concept.description: Further details may be included on the person's palliative or end of life diagnosis

concept.name: Social context
concept.description: The social setting in which the person lives, such as their household, occupational history, and lifestyle factors.

concept.name: Accommodation status
concept.description: Details of the type of accommodation where the person lives.

concept.name: Accommodation status
concept.description:
An indication of the type of accommodation where the person lives.  <br clear="none"/> 
                             <br clear="none"/> This should be based on the main or permanent residence.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for accommodation status
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Accommodation status

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Allergies and adverse reactions
concept.description: Allergies and adverse reactions

concept.name: Allergies and adverse reactions record entry
concept.description:
This is a allergies and adverse reactions record entry. There may be 1 to many record entries under a section.  <br clear="none"/> 
                         <br clear="none"/> Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Type of reaction
concept.description: The type of reaction experienced by the person (allergic, adverse, intolerance)
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set :- Allergy, Intolerance

concept.name: Causative agent
concept.description: The agent such as food, drug or substances that has caused or may cause an allergy, intolerance or adverse reaction in this person Or “No known drug allergies or adverse reactions” Or “Information not available”

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for causative agent
concept.valueSets:
dm+d:- any code from the VTM, VMP, AMP, VMPP, AMPP and ingredient concept classes
SNOMED CT : - <105590001 |Substance OR <373873005 |Pharmaceutical / biologic product| OR <<716186003 |No known allergy| OR 196461000000101 |Transfer-degraded drug allergy| OR 196471000000108 |Transfer-degraded non-drug allergy)

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Reaction details cluster
concept.description: Details of the reaction.

concept.name: Substance
concept.description: The substance, or a class of substances, that is considered to be responsible for the adverse reaction.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for substance
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - <105590001 | Substance (substance) | or <373873005 | Pharmaceutical / biologic product (product) |

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Description of reaction
concept.description: A description of the manifestation of the allergic or adverse reaction experienced by the person. For example, skin rash.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for description of reaction.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Onset date
concept.description: Date and time when manifestations showed e.g could be at home a few days earlier than the contact

concept.name: Severity
concept.description: A description of the severity of the reaction.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for severity

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Certainty
concept.description: A description of the certainty that the stated causative agent caused the allergic or adverse reaction.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for certainty.

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Route of exposure
concept.description: The route the person was exposed to the substance

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for route of exposure
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^999000051000001100 |ePrescribing route of administration simple reference set|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no coded text available

concept.name: Comment
concept.description: Any additional comment or clarification about the adverse reaction.

concept.name: Evidence
concept.description: Results of investigations that confirmed the certainty of the diagnosis. Examples might include results of skin prick allergy tests

concept.name: Date first experienced
concept.description: When the reaction was first experienced i.e this may not be the first time this has happened. May be a date or partial date (e.g. year) or text (e.g. during childhood)

concept.name: Allergy end date
concept.description: The date the allergy was diagnosed as ended

concept.name: Comment
concept.description: Any further comments on the person's allergies or adverse reactions.

concept.description: All medications and devices that can be prescribed to be entered via this Medication item entry. Handles details of continuation / addition / amendment of admission medications.

concept.description: Medication item cluster

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for site
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - <442083009 | Anatomical or acquired body structure (body structure) |

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used when code is not available

concept.name: Method
concept.description: The technique or method by which the medication is to be administered.

concept.name: Over the counter medication flag
concept.description: Indicates if the medication or device is acquired without a prescription i.e. got by the person over the counter

concept.name: Structured dose direction cluster
concept.description: A structural representation of the elements carried by the dose syntax in 'parsable dose strength / timing' i.e. dose strength, dose timing, dose duration and maximum dose.

concept.name: Structured dose amount
concept.description: A structural representation of dose amount, e.g. 20mg or 2 tablets. This element will generally only be used when persisting data within systems with 'parsable dose directions' being used to exchange the same information between systems. As per FHIR Dose Syntax Implementation Guidance (NHS Digital):  https://simplifier.net/guide/DoseSyntaxImplementationGuidanceforFHIRR4/Home

concept.name: Structured dose timing
concept.description: A slot containing a structural, computable representation of dose timing and maximum dose. This element will generally only be used when persisting data within systems with 'parsable dose directions' being used to exchange the same information between systems. As per FHIR Dose Syntax Implementation Guidance (NHS Digital):  https://simplifier.net/guide/DoseSyntaxImplementationGuidanceforFHIRR4/Home

concept.name: Dose direction duration
concept.description: Recommendation of the time period for which the medication should be continued, including direction not to discontinue. As per FHIR Dose Syntax Implementation Guidance (NHS Digital):  https://simplifier.net/guide/DoseSyntaxImplementationGuidanceforFHIRR4/Home

concept.name: Dose directions description
concept.description: Describes the entire medication dosage and administration directions including dose quantity and medication frequency and optionally duration e.g. “1 tablet at night" or “2mg at 10pm”.

concept.name: Additional instructions
concept.description: Allows for: requirements for adherence support, e.g. compliance aids, prompts and packaging requirements, additional information about specific medicines e.g. where specific brand required, person requirements, e.g. unable to swallow tablets.
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set : - Additional instruction

concept.name: Course details cluster
concept.description: Details of the overall course of medication.

concept.name: Course status
concept.description: The status of this prescription.
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set : - Medication status

concept.name: Indication
concept.description: Reason for medication being prescribed, where known.

concept.name: Start date/time
concept.description: The date and/or time that the medication course should begin.

concept.name: End date/time
concept.description: The date and/or time that the medication course should finish.

concept.name: Link to indication record
concept.description: A link to the record which contains the indication for this medication order.

concept.name: Comment/recommendation
concept.description: Suggestions about duration and/or review, ongoing monitoring requirements, advice on starting, discontinuing or changing medication. Additional comment or recommendation about the medication course e.g. 'Patient named supply', 'unlicensed medication', 'Foreign brand' or monitoring recommendations

concept.name: Medication change summary cluster
concept.description: Records the changes made to medication.

concept.name: Status
concept.description: The nature of any change made to the medication.
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set : Medication status

concept.name: Indication
concept.description: Reason for change in medication, e.g. sub-therapeutic dose, person intolerant.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT:- ^1127601000000107 | Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Date of change
concept.description: The date of the change - addition, or amendment

concept.name: Description of amendment
concept.description: Where a change is made to the medication i.e. one drug stopped and another started or eg dose, frequency or route is changed.

concept.name: Total dose daily quantity
concept.description: The total daily dose of this medication. This is helpful for estimating optimal adherence to dosing guidance. It may be computed from product/dose strength and frequency or entered manually.

concept.name: Medical devices entry
concept.description: Medical devices

concept.name: Medical device
concept.description: Any medical device that isn't prescribed.

concept.name: Comments
concept.description: Any information regarding the medical device.

concept.name: Medication discontinued entry
concept.description: Medication discontinued entry

concept.name: Name of discontinued medication
concept.description: The name of the medication or medical device being discontinued

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for medication name
concept.valueSets: dm+d:- any code from the VTM, VMP, AMP, VMPP and AMPP concept classes

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Amount of vaccine administered.

concept.name: Status
concept.description: The status of any change made to the medication. MUST CONTAIN STOPPED.
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set: - Medication status

concept.name: Indication
concept.description: The clinical indication for any changes in medication status
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT:- ^1127601000000107 | Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Date of change
concept.description: The date of the discontinuation

concept.name: Comment
concept.description: Any additional comment about the discontinuation or amendment.

concept.name: Care and support plan
concept.description: This records the decisions reached during conversation between the individual and health and care professional about future plans and also records progress.

concept.name: Strengths
concept.description: Any strengths and assets the person has relating to their goals and hopes about their health and well-being.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value associated with the person's strengths.  Could be derived from the assessment of the person e.g. 300738008 |Able to participate in leisure activities (finding)|
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - 1127601000000107 | Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: The person’s strengths (in free text). If the strengths are coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded strength.

concept.name: Needs, concerns or problems
concept.description: Details of the person needs, concerns or problems <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value associated with the person's needs, concerns or problems.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: The person’s needs, concerns or problems (in free text). If the needs, concerns or problems are coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded need, concern or problem. <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: Goals and hopes
concept.description: The overall goals, hopes, aims or targets that the person has. Including anything that the person wants to achieve that relates to their future health and wellbeing. Each goal may include a description of why it is important to the person. Goals may also be ranked in order of importance or priority to the person.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value associated with the person's goals, aim's and hopes. e.g. 999002111000000103 |Occupational therapy goals simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - 413350009|Finding with explicit context|: 246090004|Associated finding|=300798006 |Able to participate in sporting activities (finding)|, 408729009|Finding context|=410518001|Goal|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: The person’s goals and hopes (in free text). If the goals and hopes are coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded goal or hope.

concept.name: Goal importance score
concept.description: Assessment of the person's motivations to achieve this goal, how important the goal is to the person on a scale of 1-10.

concept.name: Actions and activities
concept.description: Actions or activities the person or others plan to take to achieve the person's goals and the resources required to do this.  <p/>

concept.name: What
concept.description: What the action is and how it is to be carried out?

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the action.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - <<71388002 |Procedure| OR <<129125009 |Procedure with explicit context|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: The person’s actions (in free text). If the actions are coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded action.

concept.name: Who
concept.description: Name and role (e.g. person, carer, GP, OT, etc.) of the person, or a team, carrying out the proposed action, and, if relevant where action should take place.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional or person carrying out the proposed action.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role of the person providing the service.
concept.valueSets: FHIR values set : -  ukcorepractitionerrolecode

concept.name: Team
concept.description: The name of the team.

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the professional (e.g. telephone number, email address etc.).

concept.name: When
concept.description: Planned date, time, or interval, as relevant

concept.name: Suggested strategies
concept.description: Suggested strategies for potential problems.

concept.name: Status
concept.description: The status of the action or activity e.g. in progress, done, refused

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the person's activity status
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - ^999000081000000105 | Care planning action context values simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Any supplementary or personalised information for the person's activity status

concept.name: Confidence
concept.description: How confident the person feels to carry out the action associated to the goal.

concept.name: Date last updated
concept.description: Date when action/activity record was last updated

concept.name: Review date
concept.description: When the action evaluation needs to be reviewed. SNOMED CT tag : - 425268008 | Review of care plan (procedure) |

concept.name: Stage goal
concept.description: Details of the person's stage goals

concept.name: Stage goal
concept.description: A specific sub-goal that is related to the overall goal as agreed by the person in collaboration with a professional.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded expression associated with the person's stage goal.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - 413350009|Finding with explicit context|: 246090004|Associated finding|=300798006 |Able to participate in sporting activities (finding)|, 408729009|Finding context|=410518001|Goal|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: The person’s stage goal (in free text). If the stage goal is coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded stage goal.

concept.name: Outcome
concept.description: The outcome of the stage goal

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the person's stage goal outcome.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^1127601000000107 |Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Any supplementary and personalised information relating to the person's outcome.

concept.name: Goal status
concept.description: The status associated with the person's stage goal
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^999000091000000107 | Care planning goal context values simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Outcomes
concept.description: Outcomes of each of the person’s goals, aims and targets. Includes comments recorded by the person, date and status.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value associated with the person's overall goal outcome
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^1127601000000107 |Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: The person’s outcome (in free text) of a goal. If the outcome is coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded outcome.

concept.name: Goal status
concept.description: The status associated with the person's overall goal.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^999000091000000107 | Care planning goal context values simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Agreed with person or legitimate representative
concept.description: Indicates whether the plan was discussed and agreed with the person or legitimate representative.

concept.name: Person or legitimate representative
concept.description: Indicates whether the plan was discussed and agreed with the person or legitimate representative

concept.name: Person full name
concept.description: The full name of the person in text representation.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person full name

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person.

concept.name: Care funding source
concept.description: A reference to the funding source and any conditions or limitations associated.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The organisation code of the care funding source
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - organisation data service

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Any further information for the person's care funding source e.g. self funded

concept.name: Date this plan was last updated
concept.description: This is a record of the date that this care and support plan was last updated.

concept.name: Other care planning documents
concept.description:
Reference other care planning documents, including the type, location and date.  <br clear="none"/> 
                         <br clear="none"/> This may include condition-specific plans, advance care plans, end of life care plan, etc.

concept.name: Planned review date/interval
concept.description: This is the date/interval when this information will next be reviewed. SNOMED CT tag : - 425268008 | Review of care plan (procedure) |

concept.name: Responsibility for review
concept.description: This is a record of who has responsibility for arranging review of this information. <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional with responsibility for the care of the person.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker, key worker, care home manager, care coordinator, LA hospital liaison person, care home contact, hospital clinician, Independent Mental Capacity Advocate (IMCA) etc
concept.valueSets: FHIR values set : -  ukcorepractitionerrolecode

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the professional (e.g. telephone number, email address etc.).

concept.name: Contingency plans
concept.description: These are the things to do and people to contact, should an individual’s health or other circumstances get worse.

concept.name: Trigger factors
concept.description: Signs to watch out for that may indicate a significant change in health or other circumstances e.g. feeling agitated

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The trigger that leads to instigation of a significant change in health or other circumstances. <br clear="none"/>
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^1127581000000103 | Health issues simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: The person’s trigger factors (in free text). If the trigger factor is coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded trigger factor.

concept.name: Contingency plan name
concept.description: When the action evaluation needs to be reviewed.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the type of care plan
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^999001471000000108 | Care plan type simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text if no coded value is available.

concept.name: What should happen
concept.description: Guidance on specific actions or interventions that may be required or should be avoided in specific situations. This may include circumstances where action needs to be taken if a carer is unable to care for the person. A statement of suggested actions. Usually expressed as: in the event of X do Y.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for what should happen
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - <<71388002 |Procedure| OR <<129125009 |Procedure with explicit context|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: What should happen (in free text). If 'what should happen' is coded then this is any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the coded value for 'what should happen'.
concept.valueSets: Free text

concept.name: Who should be contacted
concept.description: Who should be contacted in the event of significant problems or deterioration in health or wellbeing. e.g. name, role and contact details.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional with responsibility for the care of the person.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker, key worker, care home manager, care coordinator, LA hospital liaison person, care home contact, hospital clinician, Independent Mental Capacity Advocate (IMCA) etc
concept.valueSets: FHIR values set : -  ukcorepractitionerrolecode

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the personal contact (e.g. telephone number, address, email address etc.)

concept.description: Indicates whether the plan was discussed and agreed with the person or legitimate representative.

concept.description: Indicates whether the plan was discussed and agreed with the person or legitimate representative

concept.name: Person full name
concept.description: The full name of the person in text representation.

concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person.

concept.description: This is the date/interval when this contingency plan will next be reviewed. SNOMED CT tag : - 425268008 | Review of care plan (procedure) |

concept.name: Responsibility for review
concept.description: This is who has responsibility for arranging review of this information. <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional with responsibility for the care of the person.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker, key worker, care home manager, care coordinator, LA hospital liaison person, care home contact, hospital clinician, Independent Mental Capacity Advocate (IMCA) etc
concept.valueSets: FHIR values set : -  ukcorepractitionerrolecode

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the professional (e.g. telephone number, email address etc.).

concept.name: Coping strategies
concept.description: Details of coping strategies used

concept.name: Coping strategy
concept.description: The coping strategies are defined as thoughts and behaviours that people use to manage the internal and external demands of situations that are appraised as stressful. This should also include a record of any tools used to carry out the coping strategy.

concept.name: Start date
concept.description: The date when the coping strategy started

concept.name: End date
concept.description: The date when the coping strategy ended

concept.name: Relapse indicators / early warning signs
concept.description: Details of the relapse indicators for the person. These may also be called 'early warning signs'
concept.valueSets:

concept.name: Advance statement
concept.description: Written requests and preferences made by a person with capacity conveying their wishes, beliefs and values for their future care should they lose capacity.

concept.name: Advance statement
concept.description: Does the person have an advance statement.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for advance statement
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - 816281000000101 | Has advance statement (Mental Capacity Act 2005) (finding) |

concept.name: Location of document
concept.description: The location of where the advanced statement is held.

concept.name: Anticipatory medicines/equipment
concept.description: Medicines or equipment available that may be required in specific situations and their location. A statement regarding the availability or location of the anticipatory medicines/equipment. SNOMED CT Tag : - 871021000000106 | Prescription of palliative care anticipatory medication (procedure) |

concept.name: Additional support plans
concept.description: Additional support plans

concept.name: Additional support plan name
concept.description: The name of the particular additional supporting plan, e.g. dieticians plan, wound management plan, discharge management plan and behaviour support plan.

concept.description: The coded value for the type of care plan

concept.description: Free text if no coded value is available

concept.name: Additional support plan content
concept.description:
This is the content of any additional care and support plan which the person and/or care professional consider should be shared with others providing care and support. May be structured in different ways, e.g. tables, diagrams, images. This is the content of any additional care and support plan which the individual and/or care professional consider should
                        be shared with others providing care and support. It should be structured as recommended for the care and support plan and if contains additional detail, it may be referenced here.

concept.name: Planned review date/interval
concept.description: This is the date/interval when this information will next be reviewed. SNOMED CT tag : - 425268008 | Review of care plan (procedure) |

concept.description: This is a record of who has responsibility for arranging review of this information. Should include their name, role and contact details.

concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker, key worker, care home manager, care coordinator, LA hospital liaison person, care home contact, hospital clinician, Independent Mental Capacity Advocate (IMCA) etc
concept.valueSets: FHIR values set : -  ukcorepractitionerrolecode

concept.name: Date this plan was last updated

concept.name: Palliative and end of life care
concept.description:
Information relating to palliative and end of life care. <br clear="none"/> 
                     <br clear="none"/> N.B. This is not an end of life care plan or a palliative care plan but contains information that would be found in an end of life care or palliative care plan.

SNOMED CT: 1128811000000107 |Prognosis findings simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

  Recommended Value set to use

511401000000102 | Last days of life (finding)

955231000000109 | Last weeks of life (finding)

968211000000101 | Last months of life (finding)

767503006 | Limited life expectancy of approximately one year (finding)

1413121000000106 |Limited life expectancy of more than one year (finding)

Where services use Gold Standard Framework, they may wish to use the following value set

845701000000104   | Gold standards framework prognostic indicator stage A (blue) - year plus prognosis (finding)

845721000000108 | Gold standards framework prognostic indicator stage B (green) - months prognosis (finding)

845751000000103 | Gold standards framework prognostic indicator stage C (yellow) – weeks prognosis (finding)    

845771000000107 | Gold standards framework prognostic indicator stage D (red) - days prognosis (finding)

concept.name: Date of death
concept.description: The date on which a person died or is officially deemed to have died, as recorded on the death certificate.

concept.name: Documents (including correspondence, audio and images)
concept.description: Details about documents related to the person.

concept.name: Documents
concept.description: This is the documents record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Documentation location
concept.description: The location of the document

concept.name: Confidentiality
concept.description: The code specifying the level of confidentiality of the document.

concept.name: Class
concept.description: The document type e.g. report, summary, images, treatment plan, patient preferences, workflow

concept.name: Document title
concept.description: The title of the document.

concept.name: Document name
concept.description:
The name of the document. This should align to the PRSB document naming standard. Where the document is a KOS document this field (designated typeCode) is used to carry the DICOM Imaging procedure: This attribute shall be populated by the XDS-I Imaging Document Source from a code in the Procedure Code Sequence (0008,1032) of the performed procedure
                            with which the document is associated. Values may be found in a suitable DICOM browser
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - As per the https://theprsb.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Clinical-document-indexing-standards_NHS-Scotland.pdf

concept.name: Document MIME type
concept.description: MIME type of the document e.g. application, pdf, audio, jpeg

concept.name: Service
concept.description: The high level imaging speciality code e.g. (R-3027B, SRT, “Radiology”)

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for service
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT :- ^1127531000000102 |Services simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Comments
concept.description: Comments associated with the document.

concept.name: Additional information required for images.
concept.description: Additional information required for images.

concept.name: Image procedure
concept.description: The procedure used to capture the image
concept.valueSets:
Free text
Using DICOM code set https://dicom.innolitics.com/ciods

concept.name: Image procedure date
concept.description: The date and time the image procedure was performed.

concept.name: Performing professional
concept.description: The professional who performed the image procedure.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker etc
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set :- SDSjobroletype

concept.name: Grade
concept.description: The grade of the professional.

concept.name: Speciality
concept.description: The specialty of the professional e.g. physiotherapy, oncology, mental health etc
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary - Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Professional identifier
concept.description: Professional identifier for the professional e.g. GMC number, HCPC number etc or the personal identifier used by the local organisation.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Professional registration identifier

concept.name: Organisation
concept.description: The name of the organisation the professional works for.

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the professional
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary - UK phone number

concept.name: Images
concept.description: Images details.

concept.name: Image capture date
concept.description: The date and time when the image was captured.

concept.name: Image ID
concept.description: A unique image identifier generated by the system.

concept.name: Image location
concept.description: The URL for the image

concept.name: Format code
concept.description: The format code of the document which provides information on how to display the document.

concept.name: Event code list
concept.description: The type of image (acquisition modality) and the anatomical site imaged.

concept.name: Person completing record
concept.description: Details of the person completing the record.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the person completing the record.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The organisational role of the person completing record.

concept.name: Grade
concept.description: The grade of the person completing the record.

concept.name: Specialty
concept.description: The main specialty of the person completing the record.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Organisation
concept.description: The organisation the person completing the record works for.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Organisation data service

concept.name: Professional identifier
concept.description: Professional identifier for the person completing the record e.g. GMC number, HCPC number etc, or the personal identifier used by the local organisation.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Professional registration identifier

concept.name: Date completed
concept.description: The date and time the record was completed.

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the person completing the record. <br clear="none"/>
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - UK telephone number
